results.name: 4*Denominator of S(n)/Pi^n, where S(n) = Sum_{k=-inf..+inf} ((4k+1)^(-n)).
comment: Reduced denominators of the Favard constants.

formula: There is a simple formula in terms of Euler and Bernoulli numbers.
example: The first few values of S(n)/Pi^n are 1/4, 1/8, 1/32, 1/96, 5/1536, 1/960, ...
maple: S := proc(n, k) option remember; if k = 0 then `if`(n = 0, 1, 0) else
S(n, k - 1) + S(n - 1, n - k) fi end: EZ := n -> S(n, n)/(2^n*n!):
A050971 := n -> denom(EZ(n-1)): seq(A050971(n), n=1..19); # _Peter Luschny_, Aug 02 2017
mathematica: s[n_] := Sum[(4*k + 1)^(-n), {k, -Infinity, Infinity}]; a[n_] := 4*s[n]/Pi^n ; a[1] = 1; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 19}] // Denominator (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 05 2012 *)
a[n_] := 4*Sum[((-1)^k/(2*k+1))^n, {k, 0, Infinity}] /. Pi -> 1 // Denominator; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 19}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 20 2014 *)
Table[4/(2 Pi)^n LerchPhi[(-1)^n, n, 1/2], {n, 21}] // Denominator (* _Eric W. Weisstein_, Aug 02 2017 *)
Table[4/Pi^n If[Mod[n, 2] == 0, DirichletLambda, DirichletBeta][n], {n, 21}] // Denominator (* _Eric W. Weisstein_, Aug 02 2017 *)
